Perspective adds depth and dimension to your designs with easy-to-use perspective transformations and shadow effects.


üîÑ Perspective Transformations

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Square One
139554.release_notes:
We rebuilt Perspective from scratch because, honestly, the old code was getting a bit messy. The good news is you get a bunch of new features.

Pattern Creation
Instead of transforming one object at a time, you can now create patterns with multiple copies:
- Grid: The classic rows and columns setup
- Circle: Objects arranged in a circle (surprisingly popular)
- Line: Objects in a straight line at whatever angle you want
- Spiral: For when you're feeling fancy

No More Button Clicking
Everything updates as you drag the sliders. We got rid of all those apply buttons because frankly, clicking them was getting annoying. Your patterns stay in the document even after you close the plugin, so you won't lose your work.

Transform Options
You can control how the perspective effect applies to your pattern:
- Uniform: Every object gets the same treatment
- Incremental: Each object transforms a bit more than the last
- Random: Adds some controlled chaos to keep things interesting

Interface Cleanup
We made everything cleaner and gave the controls more breathing room. You can now create up to 100 objects in a pattern, which should be enough for most people. If you need more than 100, we probably need to have a chat!

Using It
Pick an object, open the plugin, choose your pattern, and start dragging sliders. It's pretty straightforward once you get the hang of it.

The whole thing should feel more reliable now. We spent way too much time on the technical stuff so you don't have to think about it.
139554.tagline: Transform designs with perspectives and 3D shadow effects

Introducing our latest innovation in web design, the Figma to HTML Converter. This state-of-the-art plugin is designed to streamline your workflow and simplify the process of bringing your designs to life. Our plugin takes your designs from Figma and converts them into responsive HTML & CSS blocks, which we refer to as boxes. These boxes are completely headless, meaning that they don't require any special software or dependencies to run.


One of the key benefits of our Figma to HTML Converter is that it allows you to export your designs directly into our free Str√∏mstik CMS. This modern, headless CMS is built on top of an API, and it provides you with all of the tools you need to manage and maintain your website. If you prefer, however, you can also download your entire site as a single .zip file and use it with any other CMS or web hosting solution of your choice.


The Figma to HTML Converter is designed to be easy to use, even if you have limited experience with coding or web development. This makes it an ideal solution for designers, marketers, and business owners who want to create professional-looking websites without the need for a full-time developer.

plugins.name: Figma to Web Forms
plugins.description:
Building forms and surveys, without limits

With the Figma to Web Forms plugin, you can effortlessly publish working forms & surveys from your Figma designs in a matter of seconds. Use a wide array of form elements, get creative in your form design, apply logic and collect an unlimited number of responses.


Two options to build a form

  1. Prompt-based form building: With the help of our GPT integration, generate various form templates based on your prompt. For example, provide a simple description, and the plugin will create a working form complete with form elements and relevant content. You can later easily customise the copy, type of elements, and design.
  2. Manual form building: Already have a design prepared? No worries! You can add questions manually. While you can copy-paste an existing design into the form, please note that form elements need to be styled again.


Main features

  1. Templates & styles: supercharge your form with custom themes like glassmorphism, slick, modern and more.
  2. Pop-up forms: build forms that can be integrated and precisely positioned as pop-ups on your website.
  3. Conditional logic: Specify what questions should be shown/skipped based on your respondents' answers.
  4. Teams collaboration: Team members can take full control of each other's forms, edit, publish, and access results. Create new teams, invite new members and improve your workflows.
  5. Multipage forms: Break down complex surveys into manageable pages, providing a comprehensive experience for your respondents.
  6. Answer piping: Create interactive forms with questions that adapt to user responses.
  7. Form validation: Mark specific fields as "required," ensuring that respondents provide mandatory answers.
  8. Password protection: Limit form access to authorised users by locking your form with a password.
  9. Various form elements: Radio buttons and checkboxes, ratings, dropdown, text fields, hyperlink, and many more!
  10. Data storage: Collect responses without worrying where to store data. Your respondents‚Äô data is saved locally while they are filling your survey and securely stored in our servers once they press submit.
  11. Data export in CSV: Easily export your form responses into css files to manage data the way you need.
  12. Charts & Graphs: Generate charts and graphs from the collected data, in a form of editable vectors in Figma.


Integrations

Figma to Web Forms offers native integrations with Notion, Airtable and Google Sheets. In addition, the plugin integrates with Zapier which lets you connect data that you collect from the forms with 6000+ apps.


Figma to Web Forms is powered by Weavely (https://www.weavely.ai/)

accepted.description:

We turns your visual ideas into interactive, web-based forms.

plugins.tagline: Design & Publish Forms in Figma

plugins.name: Component Inspector
plugins.description:
Component properties as they would look in code. Code on GitHub


This plugin provides a look at Figma component properties similar to how they are described in code. This plugin does not generate style code. It generates code that describes component properties.


Currently supporting instance and component code generation for:

  • React function components
  • Angular components
  • Vue components (both option and composition APIs)
  • Web components

As well as:

  • JSON


Would love to hear from you about what works and what doesn't!


Conventions / Pro Tips


Slots

Currently, this plugin supports tag-named slots. Add the --SLOT[tagname] suffix to the name of a text component property in Figma and it will generate a slot for that attribute. For example, if you create a component with a text property named "heading--SLOT[h2]", it would generate the following React instance and definition code:


<Component heading={<h2>My slot content</h2>} />



const Component: FC<{
  heading: ReactNode;
}> = ({ heading }) => <>{heading}</>;


The tagname will default to span if you use the suffix --SLOT without a tagname. If your Figma component has a single text property, it will be treated as a generic slot.

This can be configured by running the Component Inspector > Configuration command.


Boolean visibility

If you have a boolean Figma component property that controls visibility of a text or instance swap property (or one of their ancestors), that boolean property will be ignored in generated code and the text or instance swap property will disappear when the boolean is false.


"undefined" variant options and instance swaps

If you have a variant option property that defaults to the string "undefined", that property will be treated as truly optional (no default).

If you have an instance swap property that defaults to a component named "undefined", that property will be treated as truly optional (no default).

This can be configured by running the Component Inspector > Configuration command.


Ignored property prefix

You can configure the component inspector to ignore properties named with a provided prefix.

This can be configured by running the Component Inspector > Configuration command.



Numeric variant options

If your variant options are all numeric or if the default value for a text property is numeric, the generated code will treat it like a number type property.
plugins.tagline: Component properties as they would look in code.

plugins.name: Paletteer
plugins.description:
Take a proactive approach to building color palettes for digital design projects.

A flexible and diverse yet constrained color palette means the color you need for a new button or text treatment is always immediately at hand.

It's common to start a digital design project from a constrained set of key brand colors, but you will soon find yourself needing a more versatile selection of shades to refine your work and maintain accessibility. Paletteer lets you generate a more versatile set of color shades from your key brand colors. Simply select a set of objects and trigger Paletteer to generate swatches and save your new color palette to your local styles.

plugins.name: Ratios
plugins.description:
Create fixed aspect ratios with fixed positioned overlays.


Ratios

Enter any ratio above 1/2.2, meaning the height cannot be greater than 2.2 times the width.

Ratios can be entered as 00:00 or 00/00.


Overlays

Add optional fixed positioned overlays on top of the fixed aspect ratio.


Resizing

Resize the fixed aspect ratios by changing their width only (note that it might produce subpixel heights). Adjusting their height or using the ‚Äúshift‚Äù key will break the aspect ratios.


Get ratio

Get the closest aspect ratio for the currently selected object by clicking on the icon next to the ratio input field where the result will be displayed.


This plugin was created for the AREA 17 design team and is based on the article Figma components with a fixed aspect ratio elements, the Figma file Fixed aspect ratio in Figma Auto Layout by Vitalli and Auto Layout Fixed Aspect Ratio by Chudo Loo

plugins.name: Restore Image Dimensions
plugins.description:
Restore original size of the image after it has been resized/cropped inside Figma


The plugin will reset the size of an image or any other selected object that has an image fill, to the original dimensions of the image.


You can reset several objects at a time. Clipping options will be switched back to ‚ÄûFill‚Äù. This plugin will not affect masks.


Note: since this changes, Figma downscales your retina screenshots, while importing the full image. This plugin will restore original size, which may look like your image got bigger than it was.
plugins.tagline: Restore original image size of imported pictures

Figma to Flutter, parses your Figma UI designs, generates optimized Flutter widget code, and offers real-time previews for efficient iteration.

Figma UI Parsing: Figma to Flutter interprets your Figma designs, saving you time on manual conversion to code.

Flutter Widget Code Generation: Instantly convert designs into clean, optimized Dart files.

Real-time UI Preview: Visualize changes instantly within a real Flutter app environment.

Key Features:


Figma UI Parsing: Figma to Flutter interprets your Figma designs, saving you time on manual conversion to code.

Flutter Widget Code Generation: Instantly convert designs into clean, optimized Dart files.

Real-time UI Preview: Visualize changes instantly within a real Flutter app environment.
81823.tagline: Transform Your Designs into Flutter Widget

plugins.name: Text Styles Organizer
plugins.description:
Usage 
Create local text styles in a familiar way through a standard "figma" interface. Divide nesting levels through the "/" symbol. Apply style to the element through the plugin.  

Example:
"Desktop / Headers / H1 / Black-Bold
"Desktop / Headers / H1 / Black-Regular
"Desktop / Headers / H2 / Black-Bold
"Desktop / Headers / Special
... 
 
The plugin will display text styles in a convenient multi-level drop-down navigation.  

Features
‚Äî Potentially nesting levels can be infinite. But for convenience, try to limit yourself to 3 or 4 levels. 

‚Äî Do not use spaces in style names. The plugin will remove them. Instead of spaces, put "-" or "_" as real front-enders. 

‚Äî Sort the order of styles through the standard figma interface.

‚Äî The plugin is case-sensitive. The "Headers" and "headers" levels will be separated.

plugins.name: Figma2Android
plugins.description:
Plugin for easy convert from Figma designs to Android Jetpack Compose code.


Very often designs contain many different properties for elements of distance, color, proportion, as well as their layout. Developing such projects can be very tedious, and inconsistencies in design and development can negatively affect the overall design view after development.


Figma2Android plugin reduces the number of measurements of sizes, indents and positions of nodes, layer design operations and saves time / energy, even if the developer and designer are the same person.


Usage

Just open the plugin window in Figma, select a node to get the Jetpack Compose code to display it!


You can convert entire design pages, but Jetpack Compose has a limitation on the content of one function, and to make the code easier to reuse, we recommend converting in smaller blocks, just like when you develop an application in the usual way. This method will not only speed up the development of the entire application, but also immediately create a base of reusable blocks in the code.

It's still a work in progress, but my goal is to make it super easy to convert your Figma designs into clean HTML and CSS with minimal fuss. plugins.name: Kombai - HTML email code from ANY design in a click |Klaviyo, Email builder, Email template, Gmail
plugins.description:
Documentation with Tutorials

Playground File


What is Kombai for Email?

Kombai for Email lets users convert any email designed in Figma to HTML code in just a click. The autogenerated code works on all major ESPs and email clients, including the dreaded Outlook. Also, email-coding best practices are built-in to ensure responsiveness, high deliverability, and low spam risk of the autogenerated emails.


Do we need to use specific templates/ design blocks to generate code with this plugin? Are there any other rules (tagging/ autolayout etc.) that we need to follow?


No, Kombai for Email does not require your email design to be constrained by any specific templates, blocks, or rules. You don't need to use specified components/ design blocks or name/ tag the layers in any specific way. Using autolayout is also not required.


You can create your email design from scratch in Figma, use any of the publicly available email design templates or leverage Kombai‚Äôs in-built email-builder tool. Kombai is trained to create code based on how the email design would ‚Äúlook like‚Äù to a developer. Hence, as long as your Figma design visually represents the email you want to send out, it can generate a high-quality email code for this.


How do you make sure that the code actually works for Email clients? Would it pass tests on litmus/ email-on-acid etc.?

Yes! The auto-generated code uses a table structure with appropriate <table>,<tr>,<td> tags, and CSS that is widely supported across common email clients. It also uses special conditionals to ensure that the emails render correctly other clients that require specific code-handling, such as Outlook.


Specifically, we have optimized and tested the tool for the following email clients, which should cover 95-100% of email users, depending on your specific target segment:

  • Apple Mail (MacOS & iOS)
  • Gmail (iOS, Android & Desktop webmail)
  • Outlook (Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android & Outlook.com webmail) and 
  • Yahoo Email (iOS, Android, Webmail)


Kombai for email also runs all generated code through 25+ automated checks to detect any design element that might not be compatible with some email clients. The results of these automated tests can be found in the ‚ÄúEmail Compatibility‚Äù tab of the plugin. 


We, as well as our users, have extensively tested the autogenerated code with testing tools such as litmus and email-on-acid. The code usually passes these tests with flying colors. 


How do the auto-generated emails work on mobile devices?

All email codes generated by Kombai should work on mobile by default. 


In addition, for our advanced users - the tool lets you customize specific responsive behaviors, such as margins, font-size scaling, fluid behavior, etc., for any breakpoints you choose to define.


More about the mobile-compatibility and responsiveness of Kombai for Email can be found here.


What features are included in the Free and Paid plans of Kombai for Email?

The Basic version, appropriate for casual users, is available for free. The Professional version, appropriate for professional email marketers and developers, is available in monthly and annual plans. The annual plan has a 20% discount over the monthly plan.


The Basic (free) plan includes the following features:

  • Generate email code for designs in Figma (Unlimited)
  • Copy code (Unlimited)
  • Send preview emails (Unlimited)
  • Minify Code
  • Customize responsive behavior
  • Automated compatibility evaluation
  • Email design blocks for easy drag-and-drop


The professional (paid) plan includes all of the features in the basic plan, plus:

  • Unlimited code downloads with optimized images
  • Define font fallbacks for email clients that do not support non-email-safe fonts
  • Autogenerate alt-text for images
  • Premium support


Is there a free trial available?

All users get access to a free trial of the Professional plan for 5 code downloads. Once they exhaust their five free downloads, they can either pay (via Stripe) to upgrade to the Professional plan or continue using the Basic plan.


What if I do not have email designs ready?

Kombai for Email has a built-in email-builder that has several email design blocks for easy drag & drop. You can use these to build your tool.


You can also use popular drag-and-drop-email design builders like Marka, Cannoli, or Ampier to get your first design draft and then customize the designs. Similarly, there are a number of great email template libraries available in the Figma community. Here are some of our favorites:

  • The ones by Grisha, creator of Marka
  • The ones by Maool


We already use a drag-and-drop builder. How can Kombai for Email help us?

There are several solid drag-and-drop email builders, like Emailify in Figma, Stripo, Stensul, and Beefree. However, many a time, it‚Äôs not possible to create the exact email design you‚Äôd want with a drag-and-drop builder. In such cases, Kombai lets you create any design file in Figma and convert it into an HTML email in just a click.


What‚Äôs the technology under the hood?

Under the hood, Kombai for Email is powered by Kombai‚Äôs proprietary AI models that are trained to interpret designs like human developers. The models have been trained to emulate the implicit and explicit inferences developers make while writing code from designs.

You can read more about our technology here.


I would like some more help. How can I contact Kombai?

Please feel free to write to us at support@kombai.com for any additional help you might need.
plugins.tagline: Convert ANY email design to responsive HTML email that works even on Outlook, in a click.

plugins.name: UX GPT
plugins.description:
ü™Ñ Use ChatGPT in Figma as a UX Writer!

  • Generate any copy with AI powered by ChatGPT.
  • Set your preferred writing style and word count.


üöÄ How to Use

  1. To get an OpenAI API key, create an account on the OpenAI platform at https://platform.openai.com.
  2. Once you have an account, click on your profile and select "View API Keys".
  3. From there, you can create a new key and paste it into the plugin.


üìÆ Encountering Errors?

If you encounter errors while making a request to the OpenAI API, consider the following:

  • Check that your API key is valid and has not expired.
  • Check that you have not exceeded your usage limit for the billing period. You might need to upgrade your plan.
  • Try again later. The server can be overwhelmed during peak hours.
  • Check the OpenAI API documentation for the specific error code you received and follow the recommended solution.

Learn more


Created by Bumi

I hope you find it useful for your work. Please feel free to leave any comments or feedback you may have, as I am always happy to make improvements.

plugins.name: Fix San Francisco
plugins.description:
This plugin won't fix the city's problems, but it will automatically apply the correct font variant and tracking for selected texts using the San Francisco typeface.


How to Use

  1. Select a Frame or texts with ‚ÄúSF Pro‚Äù, ‚ÄúSF Pro Display‚Äù, ‚ÄúSF Pro Text‚Äù, "SF Pro Rounded", or "New York" fonts.
  2. Run ‚ÄúFix San Francisco‚Äù from Plugins menu.


The plugin will find all relevant texts in your selections and apply the fix.


Note: Texts with text style will not be changed.


Note: For New York, you must use the ‚ÄúNew York‚Äù font and not the optical variants (‚ÄúNew York Small‚Äù, ‚ÄúNew York Medium‚Äù, etc.) for the plugin to apply the appropriate tracking.


Context

When texts with SF fonts are rendered on iOS, their variant and tracking (letter spacing) are adjusted based on their point size and the user's accessibility settings. In Figma, the tracking must be manually applied to get a more accurate representation. Hence, Fix San Francisco is here to automate this process for you ‚ô•


Inspired by Sketch-SF-UI-Font-Fixer.
plugins.tagline: Easily apply the correct tracking based on font size for SF Pro and New York texts!

plugins.name: (Easy)Grid - Easy Grids and Shapes
plugins.description:
(Easy)grid lets you create interesting grids and shapes in seconds; easily placing it into Figma without the math. It can also let you quickly align and scale pre-existing elements as layout-items/cells for a quicker design flow.


By using the four flexible options ‚Äî columns, rows, and spacing ‚Äî you can write out a layout that is an exact fit, and rapidly modify until perfect.


How many times have you had to create a grid or layout, and found yourself spending too much time finding the correct sizes for each element, messing around with spacing to ensure it looks perfect, or having to perfectly align it? This is where the (Easy)grid plugin comes into play.


See https://easygrid-app.web.app/ or continue reading to learn more about the plugin and about how to use it.


You can also support me and the project by visiting https://www.Paypal.me/elirxxatia or https://buymeacoffee.com/elirazatia



Features

üé® Create layouts in seconds ‚Äî Create layout patterns in seconds ranging from a couple of rows or columns to creating the layout for whole tools and software.

üë©‚Äçüè≠ [NEW FEATURE] Combine cells into complex shapes ‚Äî Using the ‚ÄòFreeform‚Äô wand tool, you can multiple cells to combine them into one larger shape, allowing for a lot of creativity.

üéõ [NEW FEATURE] Populate cells with components ‚Äî When applying your layout to the selected layer, you may select more than one layer to populate the layouts' with its cells as the additional layers selected.

üíæ [NEW FEATURE] Saving created layouts ‚Äî Save your layout and reuse them in other Figma projects to quickly insert your most common layouts.

üóÇ [NEW FEATURE] Pre-made Layouts ‚Äî Select from pre-made grids to make your design come to life even faster, including: Golden Ratio, 12 Column Grid, iPad App With Sidebar, iPhone Safe Area, and a 12-Column Web Layout.

üë®‚Äçüíª Work faster, not harder ‚Äî Reduce mistakes and time taken by not needing to worry about sizing or positioning your layout and letting (easy)grid handle the maths.

üì≤ Insert to Figma In A Click ‚Äî Insert the layout from the plugin directly over your selected Figma layer in a single click.

‚è≥ Remembers what you wrote ‚Äî Your layout options are remembered after you move them into Figma, even after you change your selection, letting you test a layout over different sized screens, or quickly prototyping variations.



Used For

- Simple Repetitive Layouts

- Creating complex shapes

- Web / App Layouts

- Creating Lists / Grids

- Creating Patterns

- Guides For Digital Design

- Rapidly Testing Out Various Layouts

- Quickly Populating Elements Without CMD+C and CMD+V And Dragging



Quick start

1. Select any layer to use as the dimensions and position for the grid.

1. You can select multiple layers to repeat them as each grids‚Äô cell.

2. Enter the amount of cells you want in the ‚ÄòGrid columns' and ‚ÄòGrid rows‚Äô fields.

1. You can also enter the size of each cell by writing it manually (separated by spaces) either by using exact values (in points) or by using a total fraction of the grid.

3. Adjust the Column gap / Row gap to your liking.

4. Optionally, you can use the ‚ÄòDrag and Drop‚Äô or ‚ÄòFreeform‚Äô tool to merge shapes to create larger cells, or combine into unique shapes; Using the preview menu, click and drag to do so.

5. Press the ‚ÄúInsert Into Figma‚Äù button to add the grid into your artboard.

6. Quickly change values and re-insert until you are happy with the result - No more manually readjusting every layer.



More Information

Visit our website at https://easygrid-app.web.app/. We also respond to all questions and feedback posted in the comments area.
plugins.tagline: Easy generator for layouts, grids, and shapes

86321.name: (Easy)Grid - Easy Grids and Shapes
86321.description:
(Easy)grid lets you create interesting grids and shapes in seconds; easily placing it into Figma without the math. It can also let you quickly align and scale pre-existing elements as layout-items/cells for a quicker design flow.


By using the four flexible options ‚Äî columns, rows, and spacing ‚Äî you can write out a layout that is an exact fit, and rapidly modify until perfect.


How many times have you had to create a grid or layout, and found yourself spending too much time finding the correct sizes for each element, messing around with spacing to ensure it looks perfect, or having to perfectly align it? This is where the (Easy)grid plugin comes into play.


See https://easygrid-app.web.app/ or continue reading to learn more about the plugin and about how to use it.


You can also support me and the project by visiting https://www.Paypal.me/elirxxatia or https://buymeacoffee.com/elirazatia



Features

üé® Create layouts in seconds ‚Äî Create layout patterns in seconds ranging from a couple of rows or columns to creating the layout for whole tools and software.

üë©‚Äçüè≠ [NEW FEATURE] Combine cells into complex shapes ‚Äî Using the ‚ÄòFreeform‚Äô wand tool, you can multiple cells to combine them into one larger shape, allowing for a lot of creativity.

üéõ [NEW FEATURE] Populate cells with components ‚Äî When applying your layout to the selected layer, you may select more than one layer to populate the layouts' with its cells as the additional layers selected.

üíæ [NEW FEATURE] Saving created layouts ‚Äî Save your layout and reuse them in other Figma projects to quickly insert your most common layouts.

üóÇ [NEW FEATURE] Pre-made Layouts ‚Äî Select from pre-made grids to make your design come to life even faster, including: Golden Ratio, 12 Column Grid, iPad App With Sidebar, iPhone Safe Area, and a 12-Column Web Layout.

üë®‚Äçüíª Work faster, not harder ‚Äî Reduce mistakes and time taken by not needing to worry about sizing or positioning your layout and letting (easy)grid handle the maths.

üì≤ Insert to Figma In A Click ‚Äî Insert the layout from the plugin directly over your selected Figma layer in a single click.

‚è≥ Remembers what you wrote ‚Äî Your layout options are remembered after you move them into Figma, even after you change your selection, letting you test a layout over different sized screens, or quickly prototyping variations.



Used For

- Simple Repetitive Layouts

- Creating complex shapes

- Web / App Layouts

- Creating Lists / Grids

- Creating Patterns

- Guides For Digital Design

- Rapidly Testing Out Various Layouts

- Quickly Populating Elements Without CMD+C and CMD+V And Dragging



Quick start

1. Select any layer to use as the dimensions and position for the grid.

1. You can select multiple layers to repeat them as each grids‚Äô cell.

2. Enter the amount of cells you want in the ‚ÄòGrid columns' and ‚ÄòGrid rows‚Äô fields.

1. You can also enter the size of each cell by writing it manually (separated by spaces) either by using exact values (in points) or by using a total fraction of the grid.

3. Adjust the Column gap / Row gap to your liking.

4. Optionally, you can use the ‚ÄòDrag and Drop‚Äô or ‚ÄòFreeform‚Äô tool to merge shapes to create larger cells, or combine into unique shapes; Using the preview menu, click and drag to do so.

5. Press the ‚ÄúInsert Into Figma‚Äù button to add the grid into your artboard.

6. Quickly change values and re-insert until you are happy with the result - No more manually readjusting every layer.



More Information

Visit our website at https://easygrid-app.web.app/. We also respond to all questions and feedback posted in the comments area.

plugins.name: Chat2Design - Speak in Text -> See in Design
plugins.description:
Chat2Design is like having an extra pair of creative hands that work instantly. You type in what you envision for an image or a design element‚Äîsay, a futuristic hero section or a minimalist sign-up form‚Äîand the plugin creates it for you in real-time. No more creative blocks. Plus, you can get as specific as you want with your requests ask for specific background colors, border radius, shadows etc. and down to the last pixel.


Want to import previously generated designs for some finishing touches or ask your copilot to improve on? You can do that too. It's a time-saving, idea-generating machine that's perfect for designers who want to streamline their workflow and discover a constant stream of fresh design ideas.


How to use:

  1. Get an account from https://chat2.design
  2. Get your Activation Code from the Dashboard or Settings tab
  3. Activate the plugin
  4. Start generating UI elements to help with your workflow


Tips:

  • Try to be as descriptive as possible if you want something specific include colors, background colors, radius, specific elements, specific copy, fonts etc.
  • Toggle Guided Mode On for finer details
  • Toggle Guided Mode Off to quickly generate UI elements
  • Use the Regenerate button to get new ideas


  • Use the command /img (followed by your prompt here) to generate images, vector art or logos


Support / Feedback:

If you have any feedback or are looking for support you can reach out via:

  • Live chat on https://chat2.design
  • Join the Discord Server
  • Email at help@chat2.design
  • Follow us on X (Twitter) @chat2design


Ôªø

plugins.name: Figma to Shopify with Instant
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify with Instant

Build responsive Shopify pages and sections 10X faster with the Figma to Shopify plugin by Instant. Copy and paste any Figma frame to Instant and publish to your Shopify store in seconds without code.


How it works

  1. Connect, Create your Instant account at https://app.instant.so/register and connect your Shopify store to your Instant project.
  2. Copy & Paste, Design Pages or Sections in Figma and use the plugin to copy the designs, then paste it into Instant.
  3. Publish, Connect eCommerce data and actions from your Shopify store in the Instant Builder and publish your designs as Pages or Sections to your Shopify theme with one click!


Video tutorial

Watch on YouTube: Transforming Figma designs into Shopify stores


Support

If you have any questions, issues, or suggestions, please reach out to support@instant.so.


Design with Auto layout

Use auto layout as much as possible for the best result. This will automatically convert all layers to responsive web elements, making publishing your designs to Shopify even easier. If done correctly, you only need to add your finishing touches in the Instant Page Builder to make your layouts fully responsive on all devices.


Figma Starter Kit

We've released a free Figma UI Kit consisting of eCommerce sections designed with Auto layout, you can use the UI Kit as a starting point for your next project: Landing Page Starter Kit


Additional resources

  1. Figma Auto layout tutorials
  2. Explore Auto layout properties


Publish to Shopify with ease

This plugin makes it easy to turn your Figma designs into Shopify sections and pages. When you're ready to publish with Instant, we ensure your webshop is built using best practices; that way, it loads quickly across all devices.


Your design mockups are converted in Instant into native Liquid, CSS, and JavaScript code. And, we optimize for performance by minifying all the JavaScript and image files and serving assets from the Shopify CDN.


What is supported

  1. Auto layout
  2. Absolute positioning
  3. Images
  4. Borders
  5. Opacity
  6. Shadows
  7. Typography
  8. Rotation
  9. Vector and shape conversion to SVGs
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma design to Instant and publish to your Shopify store in seconds.

plugins.name: Target Flow
plugins.description:
Target Flow allows you to easily connect screens to create beautiful, intuitive user flows with customizable arrows. Choose between dashed and solid arrows to improve the clarity of your flow.


---


HOW TO USE


  1. Open Target Flow plugin.
  2. Select 2 frames you want to connect. The first frame you select will be the starting point.
  3. Select the position of start point and end point of the connector, you can also add annotation if needed.
  4. Click Apply button or you can now activate the Auto-create arrow toggle to automatically apply arrow between screen.

plugins.name: Pixelay Compare Design to Web
plugins.description:
Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin/web app documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/pixelay


Questions & Support


Pixelay is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


Pixelay is designed to be privacy and security focused ‚Äî for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/pixelay/security


Features


  1. Compare multiple Figma designs and URLs at the same time.
  2. Light-weight Chrome Extension required to compare multiple pages at once.
  3. Easily perform visual QA of your designs against the real build.
  4. Test your responsive designs, with support for multiple screen sizes (eg. desktop/mobile/tablet).
  5. Instantly switch between multiple test/dev environment website URLs.
  6. Transparency, split-screen, toggle, drag and diff overlays.
  7. Optionally specify different website page URLs per Figma frame.
  8. Supports localhost using BrowerSync or Hot Module Reloading.
  9. Built-in pixel ruler for measuring space differences in comparisons.
  10. Get perfect web builds that match your Figma designs, every time.


Never hear excuses for your designs being messed up again.

Pixelay effortlessly visually syncs up your Figma designs and your real website URL(s) with a single click.


Sync your websites and designs directly from Figma in seconds.

Pixelay syncs your designs from Figma into the browser, where your designs are automatically placed over your real website, letting you super accurately compare your designs with the real thing.


Easily compare mulitple pages and screen sizes at the same time.

Pixelay gives you a bunch of modes to help you compare Figma designs with your website. One-click toggle between: the original Figma design, your website build, transparent overlay, split screen overlay, blended diffing, draggable transparent overlay and pixel guides/rulers.


Supports any live, "localhost" or logged-in/authenticated website URLs.

Install the lightweight Chrome Extension to compare any URLs with your Figma designs; live websites, websites in development (eg. localhost) or websites that require authentication.


Pixelay Pro


10 free trials of Pixelay Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of Pixelay forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of Pixelay.


To learn more about Pixelay Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/pixelay/#pro

accepted.name: Hypermatic
accepted.description: Never send a human to do a machine's job. Spend less time crying, and more time designing.

plugins.tagline: Compare your Figma designs with real websites in the browser using smart overlays

plugins.name: Palette Importer
plugins.description:
Palette Importer creates Figma Color Styles from various color file formats.


  • Compatible with .ase, .sketchpalette, .css, and .json files
  • Figma Color Styles are automatically created from files loaded into Palette Importer
  • An additional ‚ÄòPaste Swatches‚Äô feature pastes color swatch shapes onto the Figma page
  • Any existing color names and groups contained in the file are retained
  • Individual colors and/or color groups can be toggled on or off to give control over which are included in the import


Instructions

  1. Load a compatible color file format
  2. Preview the colors and groups
  3. Click ‚ÄòPaste Swatches‚Äô to paste color swatch shapes to the Figma page
  4. Click ‚ÄòCreate Color Styles‚Äô to import the colors into the Color Styles panel


Non-Standard Format Instructions


JSON

JSON files can follow the non-standard schema that is commonly used by CSS frameworks like Tailwind and Material Design.


For example:

{
  "red": {
    "50": "#ffebee",
    "100": "#ffcdd2",
    "200": "#ef9a9a",
  },
   "indigo": {
    "50": "#e8eaf6",
    "100": "#c5cae9",
    "200": "#9fa8da"
  }
}


This will create red and indigo groups with their own 50, 100, and 200 swatches.


CSS

Palette Importer uses a custom CSS parser that only looks for color values in variables to keep things fast and simple.


For example:

:root {
  --primary: #ff0000;
  --warning: rgb(255,200,0);
  --info: rgb(0,0,255);
}


When imported this will create a group called :root with primary, warning, and info colors.


More at fusepilot.com

plugins.name: Material UI Sync
plugins.description:
Material UI Sync generates a production-ready theme from a customized Material UI Design Kit.


The following Design Kit customizations are currently supported:


  1. Design tokens: The generated theme includes customized color palettes, typography styles, breakpoints, spacing values, border radii, and shadows.
  2. Component styles: The Sync plugin generates theme code for component customizations. This feature is currently limited to the Button and Switch components. Support for more components is coming soon.


The plugin also provides a Storybook preview so you can check out the generated theme applied to Material UI directly from within Figma.


Please note that Material UI Sync is meant to be used combined with the Material UI for Figma Design Kit v5.16.0 or later.


We‚Äôre very excited to see what you think about it! This is just the start for Material UI Sync. If you have any feedback, please share it on the feedback platform.

plugins.name: FigmaGPT-text
plugins.description:
hey look here!


Looking for an appropriate title for your latest project? Just tell ChatGPT what you're doing and it will make suggestions right away.



Or, if you're struggling to come up with descriptions of design elements, ChatGPT can also help. Simply describe the element to ChatGPT and it will generate a detailed, accurate description within seconds.



Maybe you're developing a website and need some placeholder text to fill in the blanks. ChatGPT can create texts that suit your needs, whether you're looking for formal, conversational, or quirky texts.

plugins.name: Figma Walker
plugins.description:
Figma Walker is a new launcher for Figma.


You can take any actions you want from a single input field.


1. Search through Frames / Components / Page and jumps to the location.

2. Insert component by searching through your Master Components.

3. Create Component from the selected nodes.


You can walk through your project without lifting your keyboard.


## Keybinding


- Select Down

Arrow Down Key / Ctrl + n


- Select Up

Arrow Up Key / Ctrl + p


- Action on selected row

Return (Enter) Key / Mouse Click


## Feedback


If there is any issue or feedback, Please feel free to open an issue!

https://github.com/kawamurakazushi/figma-walker/issues

Search through 1,800+ AI generated avatars


AI Generated Avatars let's you search through 1,800+ avatars that were generated (using ChatGPT and DALL¬∑E 3). These avatars are perfect as placeholder images or placeholder graphics for your web design or app design project. Here are more details:


üëãüèª First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All avatars are available to use for your projects


üëµ Filter by Age Group:

  1. Choose from 5 different age groups
  2. Useful if you're building products or designs for different age groups or demographics
  3. Currently includes the following age groups: 12 - 18, 19 - 25, 26 - 35, 36 - 50, 50+


üíÅ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Filter by Gender:

  1. Use this to find specific avatars for the use-case of your design
  2. Over 900+ avatars for the male and female genders
  3. Currently includes the following genders: Male, Female


üå¥ Filter by Ethnic Group:

  1. Choose from 7 different ethnic groups (or ethnicities)

  3. Also great to ensure you're designs are more representative of the world
  4. Currently includes the following Ethnic Groups: Asian, Black, Hispanic, Indian, Middle Eastern, Native, White


üõù Customize Grid Size:

  1. Change the grid size in the plugin from 1 to 5 avatars per row
  2. This helps you see the fidelity and resolution of the avatars


ü§î More:

  1. Drag and drop: just drag your avatar to the exact place in your Figma Design that you want it to go
  2. Click: click on any avatar to add it to the exact center of your design
  3. All avatars are added as the top most layer so you can easily find it

plugins.name: ËÉåÊôØÊì¶Èô§ Removebg
plugins.description:
Introduction:

Removebg Background Removal is a powerful and easy-to-use Figma plugin designed to help you quickly and efficiently remove backgrounds from images. Whether you are working with a single image or multiple images, this plugin allows you to cleanly isolate subjects with just one click.


Features:

  1. Single Image Background Removal: Select a single image and remove the background instantly with one click.
  2. Multiple Images Background Removal: Select multiple images and remove their backgrounds all at once.
  3. Language Support: The plugin supports multiple languages including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.
  4. Real-time Preview: View a preview of the background removal effect before applying it.
  5. Easy Integration: Integrate seamlessly into your Figma workflow.


Instructions:

  1. Install the Plugin: Install the Removebg Background Removal plugin from the Figma plugin library.
  2. Select Images: Select the image(s) you want to remove the background from.
  3. Choose the Mode: Switch between ‚ÄúSingle Image‚Äù and ‚ÄúMultiple Images‚Äù modes using the tabs.
  4. Remove Background:
  5. For single images, click the ‚ÄúRemove Background‚Äù button.
  6. For multiple images, click the ‚ÄúProcess All Selected Images‚Äù button.
  7. Apply the Effect: Click the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button to apply the background removal effect to your selected image(s).
  8. Language Settings: Use the language selector to switch the plugin‚Äôs interface language.


Notes:

136436.name: ËÉåÊôØÊì¶Èô§ Removebg
136436.description:
Introduction:

Removebg Background Removal is a powerful and easy-to-use Figma plugin designed to help you quickly and efficiently remove backgrounds from images. Whether you are working with a single image or multiple images, this plugin allows you to cleanly isolate subjects with just one click.


Features:

  1. Single Image Background Removal: Select a single image and remove the background instantly with one click.
  2. Multiple Images Background Removal: Select multiple images and remove their backgrounds all at once.
  3. Language Support: The plugin supports multiple languages including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.
  4. Real-time Preview: View a preview of the background removal effect before applying it.
  5. Easy Integration: Integrate seamlessly into your Figma workflow.


Instructions:

  1. Install the Plugin: Install the Removebg Background Removal plugin from the Figma plugin library.
  2. Select Images: Select the image(s) you want to remove the background from.
  3. Choose the Mode: Switch between ‚ÄúSingle Image‚Äù and ‚ÄúMultiple Images‚Äù modes using the tabs.
  4. Remove Background:
  5. For single images, click the ‚ÄúRemove Background‚Äù button.
  6. For multiple images, click the ‚ÄúProcess All Selected Images‚Äù button.
  7. Apply the Effect: Click the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button to apply the background removal effect to your selected image(s).
  8. Language Settings: Use the language selector to switch the plugin‚Äôs interface language.


Notes:

Ensure that the selected images are suitable for background removal for best results.

plugins.name: Boxicons Set by Iconduck
plugins.description:
The 1,500 user interface icons in this plugin are available for personal and commercial purposes. They're licensed under the CC BY 4.0 licenses.


It's a comprehensive set that will likely work for whatever design project you're working on next.


They're solid icons and that can easily be re-colored in Figma in order to suit your brand and identity.


Popular icons included:

  • Profile and avatar icons
  • Liking and favoriting icons
  • Chat bubble and message icons
  • Message sending icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Boxicons icons
  • View your search history
  • View your embed history

plugins.name: Avocode
plugins.description:
Hand-off design versions to other stakeholders who need to work with them, while keeping your work in Figma intact.


In Avocode, anyone from your team can:


- review design versions from Figma & leave feedback (while not seeing all your exploration work)

- click through and edit screen flow logic

- edit copy in text fields

- inspect all layers, get specs, pick colors, export assets as PNG, JPEG, WebP, and SVG

- export pure standards-based CSS, Sass, Stylus, Less, SCSS, CSS in JS, Styled Components, Swift, Android, and React Native from layers


Learn more at https://avocode.com/


How to use the Avocode plugin?


1. Make sure you are logged into your Avocode account.

2. In Figma, go to Plugins and pick Avocode. You should see a new export window.

3. Select any number of frames and hit EXPORT.

4. Avocode will open in a new browser tab. Choose a project or folder where your wish to sync your designs, and that‚Äôs it.


We welcome any feedback on how to improve our Figma plugin. If you have any suggestions or issues, please contact us at team@avocode.com

plugins.name: Structure
plugins.description:
HTML & SASS code generator / fine-tune results / easy to use.

________

üèõÔ∏è What is Structure ?

This plugin generates HTML & SASS code from Figma. 
Select an object, a component, a frame, anything, then click on "Inspect" and voil√† ! 

BUT.. one problem with code generators can be code redundancy, especially with Figma objects where you can find instances inside instances inside..

In order to get a much cleaner code, you can use different options : 

‚Ä¢ use " ‚Üë " to merge a div (and its css properties) with the parent div
‚Ä¢ use " - " to remove an element from code

Merging and deleting affect both HTML and SASS generated code. You can freely experiment things, as you can find an undo button, if something didn't go as expected.

________

üß∞ Options

‚Ä¢ You can adjust settings by clicking on the "‚ñ†" option (flex, absolute or relative positioning,..)
‚Ä¢ You can double click inside an input field to zoom on the Figma object related to your code
‚Ä¢ Figma styles can be displayed (or not) inside SASS code
‚Ä¢ Images are generated as base64 background in the preview, but are not added to SASS code.
‚Ä¢ Vectors are generated as SVGs, and you can display/hide them in HTML code.
‚Ä¢ This plugin works best with objects using autolayout (support for spacing, alignement,..)
‚Ä¢ HTML & CSS are rendered inside the preview zone, so you can easily see how your actions affect rendered code.

________

üóíÔ∏è  Notes

‚Ä¢ Using this plugin doesn't change anything in your Figma file.
‚Ä¢ This plugin is a WIP, and may not cover every cases. If you find bugs, or missing something from it, please feel free to contact me.
